intro: Bothriocline attenuata, commonly known as the slender lily. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in early summer. Bothriocline attenuata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively low maintenance.
